snippet: In Florida, an even higher number approve of normalizing relations with Havana, according to the survey’s results, described as an unprecedented reflection of shifting American attitudes.
abstract: Survey commissioned by research institution the Atlantic Council finds that a majority of Americans favor normalizing relations or engaging directly with the Cuban government.
lead_paragraph: In Florida, an even higher number approve of normalizing relations with Havana, according to the survey’s results, described as an unprecedented reflection of shifting American attitudes.

headline.main: Majority of Americans Favor Ties With Cuba, Poll Finds
headline.print_headline: Many in U.S. Favor Ties With Cuba, Poll Finds
